longDef.en: to refuse to obey a person, decision, law, situation, etc.

examples.en: It is rare to see children openly defying their teachers.
examples.cn: 很少看见孩子公然跟老师作对。

examples.en: A few workers have defied the majority decision and gone into work despite the strike.
examples.cn: 几个工人不顾大多数人的罢工决定自己去上工了。

examples.en: The fact that aircraft don't fall out of the sky always seems to me to defy (= act against) the law of gravity.
examples.cn: 我总认为飞机没有从天上掉下来，是不符合万有引力定律的。

examples.en: A forest fire raging in southern California is defying (= is not changed by) all attempts to control it.
examples.cn: 尽管采取了各种措施，加利福尼亚南部的一场森林大火依然在肆虐。

longDef.en: to be extreme or very strange and therefore impossible to believe, describe, or explain:
longDef.cn: 机场一片混乱，难以用语言形容。

examples.en: The chaos at the airport defies description.
examples.cn: 机场一片混乱，难以用语言形容。

longDef.en: to tell someone to do something that you think will be impossible:
longDef.cn: 我倒要看看你能不能拿出证据来证实你的指控。

examples.en: I defy you to prove your accusations.
examples.cn: 我倒要看看你能不能拿出证据来证实你的指控。
